titleStmt.title: John D. Taylor to James F. Robinson
CWG8541

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: Enclosed you will find a petition to remit a fine imposed upon Mr Bradshaw.

The petition and accompanyiing copy of the Indictment exhibit the history of the case and the circumstances of its inflection; I hope they are such as will authorize your interference and if you cannot remit. it would be a great Relief to the petitioners if you will postpone its collection.

Most Respectfully
yrs
Jno D Taylor

Honble Jas F Robinson
Frankfort Ky

Honble James F Robinson
Frankfort
Ky
